title: Albert Llovera
text:
Albert Llovera Massana (born 11 September 1966) is a <a href="rallying">rally</a> driver and former <a href="alpine%20skiing">alpine skier</a> from <a href="Andorra">Andorra</a>. He became the youngest athlete to compete in the <a href="Winter%20Olympics">Winter Olympics</a> in 1984 at the age of 17. A serious accident in 1985 left him paralysed from the waist down. He has since taken up rallying, using cars with specially adapted hand controls. He is currently competing in the <a href="Super%202000%20World%20Rally%20Championship">Super 2000 World Rally Championship</a>.
Career.
At the age of 17, Llovera became the youngest ever athlete to compete in the <a href="Winter%20Olympics">Winter Olympics</a> when he represented Andorra at the <a href="1984%20Winter%20Olympics">1984 games</a> in <a href="Sarajevo">Sarajevo</a>, <a href="Socialist%20Federal%20Republic%20of%20Yugoslavia">Yugoslavia</a>. In the following year, 1985, whilst competing in the European Ski Cup, also in Sarejevo, he suffered a serious accident which left him using a wheelchair with <a href="paraplegia">paraplegia</a> beginning at lower back level.
He turned to motorsport, first competing on <a href="quad%20bikes">quad bikes</a> and then starting in rallying. In 1989 he won the Peugeot Rally Cup in Andorra. In 2001, with the support of <a href="Fiat">Fiat</a>, he began competing in the <a href="Junior%20World%20Rally%20Championship">Junior World Rally Championship</a> in a <a href="Fiat%20Punto%20S1600">Fiat Punto S1600</a>. He continued in the championship in 2002.
After competing in Spain along with selected WRC appearances he returned full-time to the world stage in 2010 to contest the <a href="Super%202000%20World%20Rally%20Championship">Super 2000 World Rally Championship</a> in a <a href="Fiat%20Abarth%20Grande%20Punto%20S2000">Fiat Abarth Grande Punto S2000</a>. He finished fifth in class on his first event <a href="2010%20Rally%20Mexico">Rally Mexico</a>. He scored a best overall result of 17th on <a href="2010%20Rally%20Catalunya">Rally Catalunya</a>, which was not a round of the SWRC.
He continued in the SWRC in 2011, finishing fourth in the category in <a href="2011%20Jordan%20Rally">Jordan</a>.
In 2020 he will be competing the Dakar rally in an Iveco truck from the Dutch Team de Rooy.
